intro: Zosterophyllanthos apopsis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the order Zosterophyllophyta. It is characterized by its simple, ribbon-like leaves that resemble those of early land plants, suggesting a possible link to early plant evolution. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its structure includes a short, unbranched stem with spirally arranged leaves, which are often less than 1 cm in length. Zosterophyllanthos apopsis is considered a living fossil, providing valuable insights into the transition from aquatic to terrestrial plant life.
